contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Peer |name =The Earl of Worcester |image =Worcester3.JPG |image_size =225px |caption =William Somerset, 3rd Earl of Worcester in his suit of [[Greenwich armor]] |birth_name = |birth_date =c.1526 |birth_place = |death_date =21 February 1589 |death_place =[[Hackney (parish)|Hackney]] |death_cause = |body_discovered = |resting_place =[[Church of St Cadoc, Raglan, Monmouthshire]] |resting_place_coordinates = |title =3rd Earl of Worcester |tenure =1549–1589 |other_titles = |other_names = |known_for = |years_active = |nationality =[[England|English]] |residence = |locality = |networth = |wars_and_battles = |offices = |predecessor = |heir = |successor =[[Edward Somerset, 4th Earl of Worcester]] |spouse =Christian North |issue =[[Edward Somerset, 4th Earl of Worcester]]<br>Elizabeth Somerset<br>Lucy Somerset |parents =[[Henry Somerset, 2nd Earl of Worcester]]<br>[[Elizabeth Somerset, Countess of Worcester (d. 1565)]] |signature = |footnotes = |misc = }} '''William Somerset, 3rd Earl of Worcester''', [[Knight of the Garter|KG]] (c. 1526 â€“ 21 February 1589) was born before 1526 to [[Henry Somerset, 2nd Earl of Worcester]] and his second wife [[Elizabeth Somerset, Countess of Worcester (died 1565)|Elizabeth Browne]]. On 26 November 1549, he succeeded his father and became the 3rd [[Earl of Worcester]]. Before 19 May 1550, Worcester married [[Christian North, Countess of Worcester|Christian North]]. She was a daughter of [[Edward North, 1st Baron North]] and his wife Alice Squire.<ref name="isbn0-8063-1750-7">{{cite book |author=KIMBALL G. EVERINGHAM; Richardson, Douglas Scott |authorlink= |editor= |others= |title=Plantagenet Ancestry: A Study In Colonial And Medieval Families (Royal Ancestry) |edition= |language= |publisher=Genealogical Publishing Company |location= |year=2004 |origyear= |pages= 667|quote= |isbn=0-8063-1750-7 |oclc= |doi= |url= http://books.google.com/books?id=p_yzpuWi4sgC&pg=RA1-PA667&dq=William+Somerset+3rd+Earl+of+Worcester&as_brr=3&ei=OIybSOWWIo3wjAHH76T6BA&sig=ACfU3U0ZCtXiboyJRvksLm7TFBCKiUjnqg|accessdate=}}</ref> They were parents to three children: *[[Edward Somerset, 4th Earl of Worcester]] (d. 3 March 1628). *Elizabeth Somerset. Married William Windsor. He was a namesake son of [[William Windsor, 2nd Baron Windsor]] by his wife Margaret Sambourne. *Lucy Somerset. Married Henry Herbert, [[Esquire]].<ref name="isbn0-8063-1750-7" /> Worcester supported [[Lady Jane Grey]] in 1553. He was invested as Knight, Order of the Garter (K.G.) in 1570. William Somerset died at his house [[Hackney (parish)|Hackney]] on 21 February 1589 and was buried in the [[Church of St Cadoc, Raglan, Monmouthshire]].<ref>Newman, John (2002). Gwent/Monmouthshire. New Haven; London: Yale University Press. p. 305. ISBN 978-0-300-09630-9.</ref> He was a patron of the arts, and sponsored - among others - the eminent [[Elizabethan]] actor [[Edward Alleyn]]. ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{DNB Cite|wstitle=Somerset, William}} {{s-start}} {{s-reg|en}} {{succession box | title=[[Earl of Worcester]] | before=[[Henry Somerset, 2nd Earl of Worcester|Henry Somerset]] | after=[[Edward Somerset, 4th Earl of Worcester|Edward Somerset]] | years=1549–1589}} {{s-end}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME=Somerset, William, 3rd Earl of Worcester |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Earl of Worcester |DATE OF BIRTH=c. 1526 |PLACE OF BIRTH= |DATE OF DEATH= 21 February 1589 |PLACE OF DEATH= [[Hackney (parish)|Hackney]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Worcester, William Somerset, 3rd Earl of}} [[Category:People of the Tudor period]] [[Category:Knights of the Garter]] [[Category:Earls of Worcester (1514)|*03]] [[Category:Barons Herbert|*05]] [[Category:1520s births]] [[Category:1589 deaths]] [[Category:Somerset family]] [[Category:Earls in the Peerage of England]] [[Category:16th-century English people]] {{England-earl-stub}}
